rComments: Jason makes good points, but he doesn't know how to communicate them to his pupils. Jason will threaten you in class and will make you feel uncomfortable. He cannot have a conversation with you outside of the classroom and will ignore you when he sees you. Jason will have you write a response, but fail you if you think differently than he does.

Jason is one of my favorite professors at Santa Cruz. Sometimes he's a little fussy but his helpfulness and his caring attitude towards his students makes up for it. His ideas are super interesting and I was never bored in class.

He could be a really good teacher if he wasn't so uptight. He complained way too much about so many things it would have been better if he just got on with his job. I've heard from peers that he's too negative. I agree. It's too bad b/c he makes good points. Prepare for a lowered self-esteem if you take a class with this guy!

Jacobs is pretty cool, I'd like to get to know him outside of class because I think he probably wouldn't come off as such a goober. He's kinda uptight, but he seems like he'd make a fun shopping buddy or something. Discussions were super boring. You can get away with not reading, just have to talk in class a lot. Papers were easy.
